Internal user network connections to dom.Action: Compare Zeek conn.log and dns.log against threat intelligence feeds containing domains/IPs linked to malvertising infrastructure (hosting, redirectors). Identify connections originating from internal IPs to these external destinations. Use frequency analysis to detect multiple users connecting to the same suspicious domain.

Network traffic originating from user ma.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek dns.log
Network traffic originating from user ma.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log, http.log, and dns.log for connections to known malicious URLs/domains from internal hosts, particularly those identified via threat intelligence related to malvertising campaign landing pages or payload delivery sites. Analyze connection volume, source IPs, and request patterns. Use time series analysis to identify sudden spikes in connections to unusual external domains.

Network connections originating from web.Data: Zeek http.log; Zeek conn.log; Zeek dns.log
Network connections originating from web.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log for suspicious User-Agent strings or HTTP Referer headers that might indicate traffic originating from an advertisement click (e.g., referers from ad platforms). Correlate with Zeek conn.log and dns.log to identify connections to domains with low reputation or those observed for the first time within the environment using statistical measures like frequency distribution of new domains or analysis of domain age/reputation scores from external feeds. Flag connections associated with both suspicious referers/user agents and low-reputation/newly seen domains.

Execution of suspicious files downloaded.Data: Windows Event ID 4688; Zeek http.log; Zeek conn.log
Execution of suspicious files downloaded.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) on endpoints for execution of executable file types downloaded by web browsers (e.g., `cmd.exe`, `powershell.exe`, `.exe`, `.dll` from browser cache locations). Correlate these process creations with Zeek http.log entries showing corresponding file downloads and Zeek conn.log entries showing connections to the source server. Use correlation analysis to link suspicious process activity to specific web download events, especially those originating from domains flagged as suspicious by other rules or threat intelligence.
